page.title: 10 PARISH CHURCHES
page.content: {St. Mark's}Church in Highcliffe is built of stone and holds 360 people. The vicar is the{Rev.John Seaford}and the curate is the{Rev.Barry Fry. They have four services every Sunday. The church was built in 1843 by Lord Stuart de Rothesay.It has been enlarged three times. The{Rev.John Seaford}is also the vicar of{St.Michael's}Church at Hinton.It was built in Victorian times but its tower was built in the 18th Century. There are six services each month. {St Mary Magdalene}is in Old Milton and the vicar is the{Rev. S.A. Outhwaite. The stone tower was built in 1595. The church was built in 1837 and is built of brick. They have four services each Sunday. By James Horton and Colin White.
